intro: Murdannia vaginata var. glabrisepala, commonly known as the smooth-sepal murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically greenish-white with three sepals that are smooth and glabrous, distinguishing it from other varieties. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. The plant is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
